entries.name: from_state(opts)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a State object from opts, which ought to be Hash to create a new State instance configured by opts, something else to create an unconfigured instance. If opts is a State object, it is just returned.

entries.name: new(opts = {})click to toggle source
entries.desc: Instantiates a new State object, configured by opts.

entries.name: [](name)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the value returned by method name.

entries.name: []=(name, value)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the attribute name to value.

entries.name: allow_nan?click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true, if NaN, Infinity, and -Infinity should be generated, otherwise returns false.

entries.name: array_nl()click to toggle source
entries.desc: This string is put at the end of a line that holds a JSON array.

entries.name: array_nl=(array_nl)click to toggle source
entries.desc: This string is put at the end of a line that holds a JSON array.

entries.name: ascii_only?click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true, if only ASCII characters should be generated. Otherwise returns false.

entries.name: buffer_initial_lengthclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This integer returns the current initial length of the buffer.

entries.name: buffer_initial_length=(length)click to toggle source
entries.desc: This sets the initial length of the buffer to length, if length > 0, otherwise its value isn't changed.

entries.name: check_circular?click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true, if circular data structures should be checked, otherwise returns false.

entries.name: configure(opts)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Configure this State instance with the Hash opts, and return itself.

entries.name: depthclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This integer returns the current depth of data structure nesting.

entries.name: depth=(depth)click to toggle source
entries.desc: This sets the maximum level of data structure nesting in the generated JSON to the integer depth, #max_nesting = 0 if no maximum should be checked.

entries.name: generate(obj)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Generates a valid JSON document from object obj and returns the result. If no valid JSON document can be created this method raises a GeneratorError exception.

entries.name: indent()click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the string that is used to indent levels in the JSON text.

entries.name: indent=(indent)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the string that is used to indent levels in the JSON text.

entries.name: initialize_copy(orig)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Initializes this object from orig if it can be duplicated/cloned and returns it.

entries.name: max_nestingclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This integer returns the maximum level of data structure nesting in the generated JSON, #max_nesting = 0 if no maximum is checked.

entries.name: max_nesting=(depth)click to toggle source
entries.desc: This sets the maximum level of data structure nesting in the generated JSON to the integer depth, #max_nesting = 0 if no maximum should be checked.

entries.name: object_nl()click to toggle source
entries.desc: This string is put at the end of a line that holds a JSON object (or Hash).

entries.name: object_nl=(object_nl)click to toggle source
entries.desc: This string is put at the end of a line that holds a JSON object (or Hash).

entries.name: space()click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the string that is used to insert a space between the tokens in a JSON string.

entries.name: space=(space)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets space to the string that is used to insert a space between the tokens in a JSON string.

entries.name: space_before()click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the string that is used to insert a space before the ':' in JSON objects.

entries.name: space_before=(space_before)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the string that is used to insert a space before the ':' in JSON objects.

entries.name: to_hclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the configuration instance variables as a hash, that can be passed to the configure method.

entries.name: merge(p1)
entries.desc: Alias for: configure

entries.name: to_hash()
entries.desc: Alias for: to_h
